marketNews.title: US Inflation Meets Expectations, Fed Rate Cut Expectations Rise
marketNews.content: US consumer price index (CPI) for November 2024 rose to 2.7 percent year‑on‑year and 0.3 percent month‑on‑month, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics (https://www.bls.gov/news.release/cpi.nr0.htm). This is higher than the October 2024 CPI of 2.6 percent YoY and 0.2 percent MoM, marking the highest monthly inflation in seven months and above the Federal Reserve's 2 percent target, yet both the annual and monthly rates were in line with consensus expectations. Following the data release, the market became more optimistic about a possible Fed rate cut at the December 2024 meeting, scheduled for next week. The CME FedWatch Tool shows the probability of a 25‑basis‑point cut at the December meeting rising from 73.8 percent on Wednesday (4/12) to 98.6 percent on Thursday (12/12). Conversely, the probability of a cut of 75 basis points or more by June 2025 fell from 53.5 percent on Wednesday to 48.1 percent on Thursday. On Wednesday (11/12) US equity markets were mixed: the Nasdaq gained 1.77 percent, the S&P 500 rose 0.82 percent, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average slipped 0.22 percent. Meanwhile, the 10‑year US Treasury yield increased by 4 basis points to 4.27 percent and the US dollar index (DXY) rose 0.29 percent to 106.71. Key Takeaway: Although expectations for a Fed rate cut in December have risen, the strengthening US dollar puts pressure on the Indonesian rupiah and may limit Bank Indonesia's ability to follow the Fed in cutting rates. Bank Indonesia said it is ready to intervene in the foreign‑exchange market to stabilise the rupiah, which is currently slightly below the psychological level of 16,000 per US dollar (source: https://emailer.stockbit.com/t/c/8646f3e7-d687-4632-a1ce-4594c943901c/6b66c67b-db5c-4c37-a454-acca3e13e648).

marketNews.title: International Energy Agency Projects Global Oil Supply Surplus
marketNews.content: The International Energy Agency (IEA) projects that global crude oil supply will remain in surplus by 1.4 million barrels per day if OPEC+ restores its production in April 2025. If OPEC+ cancels the production recovery, the surplus would still be about 950,000 barrels per day. The IEA expects global oil consumption to grow by 1.1 million barrels per day in 2025, a 1 percent year‑on‑year increase to 103.9 million barrels per day. Supply from non‑OPEC+ sources is projected to rise by roughly 36 percent, led by the United States, Brazil, Canada and Guyana (source: https://www.iea.org/reports/oil-market-report-december-2024).

marketNews.title: Gaikindo Reports BYD Vehicle Wholesale Sales Increase
marketNews.content: Gaikindo reported that BYD's wholesale vehicle sales in November 2024 increased by 14 percent month‑on‑month to 2,842 units, raising BYD's market share to 3.8 percent (October 2024: 3.2 percent). Cumulatively for the first eleven months of 2024, BYD sold 13,866 units, achieving a market share of 1.8 percent (10M24: 1.6 percent).

marketNews.title: Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia Announces Fuel Subsidy Scheme Change for 2025
marketNews.content: Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said the government will modify the fuel subsidy scheme in 2025, although details were not disclosed. Previously, Bahlil explained that the subsidy would be delivered through a blended approach, combining direct cash assistance (BLT) and quota‑based subsidies for the fuel commodity (source: https://epaper.kontan.co.id/mobile/harian/2024/12/12).

marketNews.title: Investment Minister Rosan Roeslani Claims Apple to Invest $1 Billion in Indonesia in 2026
marketNews.content: Investment and Industrial Development Minister Rosan Roeslani claimed that Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) has committed to invest US$1 billion in Indonesia in 2026 (source: https://epaper.kontan.co.id/mobile/harian/2024/12/12).

marketNews.title: Pefindo CEO Projects Corporate Bond Issuance 2025 at 139-155 Trillion Rupiah
marketNews.content: Irmawati Amran, President Director of Pefindo, projected that corporate bond issuance in 2025 will range between 139 and 155 trillion rupiah, compared with an estimate of 146‑151 trillion rupiah for 2024. The outlook is driven by refinancing needs, a strengthening real‑sector activity, and lower benchmark interest rates. The total amount of bonds maturing in the following year is expected to reach 150‑156.7 trillion rupiah. According to Pefindo economist Suhindarto, corporate bond coupons in 2025 will follow the 10‑year government bond yield, estimated at 6.31‑6.69 percent, lower than the 2024 range of 6.65‑7.2 percent (source: https://epaper.kontan.co.id/mobile/harian/2024/12/12).

marketNews.title: Housing and Settlement Minister Proposes 3 Million Low‑Income Homes per Year
marketNews.content: Housing and Settlement Minister Maruarar Sirait and Agrarian and Spatial Planning Minister Nusron Wahid proposed a program to build three million low‑income houses per year, aiming to make it a national strategic program (PSN). Maruarar said the proposal considered a budget of 5 trillion rupiah from the 2025 state budget, which could only construct about 225,000 houses. Bambang Ekajaya, Vice Chairman of the DPP Real Estate Indonesia, said the three‑million‑house program could facilitate funding prioritisation from the government (source: https://www.kompas.com/properti/read/2024/12/11/180000521/ara-nusron-usul-soal-psn-rumahbuat-mbr; https://nasional.kontan.co.id/news/pengembang-dukung-program-3-juta-rumah-jadi-proyek-strategis-nasional).

marketNews.title: National Energy Council Member Highlights Nuclear Power Plant Plans
marketNews.content: National Energy Council member Agus Puji Prasetyono said there are 29 locations in Indonesia that could host nuclear power plants (PLTN). The first phase will focus on four sites: West Kalimantan, Bangka Belitung, Southeast Sulawesi, and North Maluku. These locations were chosen because they are near mines or smelters. The council estimates that operating all 29 plants would add 45‑54 gigawatts of electricity to the national grid. The first nuclear plant is targeted to be operational by 2032 with a capacity of 250 megawatts (source: https://epaper.kontan.co.id/mobile/harian/2024/12/12).

marketNews.title: FIFA Announces Joint Hosts for World Cup 2030 and 2034
marketNews.content: FIFA announced on Wednesday (11/12) that Spain, Portugal and Morocco will jointly host the 2030 FIFA World Cup, while the 2034 edition will be held in Saudi Arabia (source: https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/c1j0p3x0klzo).

tickerNews.title: EMTK Purchases 100 Million SCMA Shares
tickerNews.content: Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK) bought 100 million shares of SCMA at a price of 180 rupiah per share on 11 December 2024, amounting to a total transaction value of 18 billion rupiah. After the transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 61.18 percent to 61.32 percent. This purchase marks EMTK's third acquisition of SCMA shares within the last week, following a purchase of 87 million shares (0.12 percent) on 4‑5 December 2024 (source: https://snips.stockbit.com/snips-terbaru/ppn-12-hanya-berlaku-untuk-barang-mewah#:~:text=%24SCMA%3A%20Pengendali%20Surya%20Citra%20Media%2C%C2%A0Elang%20Mahkota%20Teknologi%C2%A0(%24EMTK)%2C%C2%A0membeli%2087%20juta%20saham%20SCMA%C2%A0dengan%20harga%C2%A0137%20rupiah%20per%20lembar%C2%A0pada%204%E2%80%935%20Desember%202024.%20Total%20nilai%20transaksi%20mencapai%C2%A011%2C9%20miliar%20rupiah.%20Setelah%C2%A0transaksi%20ini%2C%20kepemilikan%20EMTK%20di%20SCMA%20naik%20dari%2060%2C97%25%20menjadi%2061%2C09%25.) and a purchase of 68 million shares (0.09 percent) on 6‑9 December 2024 (source: https://snips.stockbit.com/snips-terbaru/-ocbc-cimb-dikabarkan-berminat-akuisisi-pnbn-kk9z9#:~:text=%24SCMA%3A%20Pengendali%20Surya,5%20Desember%202024.).

tickerNews.title: Astra International Reports Decline in Domestic Vehicle Wholesale Sales
tickerNews.content: Astra International ($ASII) recorded domestic vehicle wholesale sales of 39,408 units in November 2024, a decline of 17 percent year‑on‑year and 10 percent month‑on‑month, worse than the industry‑wide decline of 12 percent YoY and 4 percent MoM. Consequently, ASII's market share fell to 53 percent in November 2024 (November 2023: 56 percent; October 2024: 56.5 percent). The drop was mainly driven by a 26 percent YoY (29 percent MoM) decline in Daihatsu sales to 10,030 units, while Toyota and Lexus sales slightly improved to 27,183 units (down 12.7 percent YoY, down 0.1 percent MoM). For the first eleven months of 2024, ASII's wholesale vehicle sales decreased 14 percent YoY to 440,806 units, with a market share of 56.2 percent (11M23: 55.7 percent).

tickerNews.title: XL Axiata Clarifies No Job Cuts Amid Merger Plans
tickerNews.content: XL Axiata ($EXCL) stated in a clarification to the Indonesia Stock Exchange that neither EXCL nor Smartfren Telecom ($FREN) intend to lay off employees as part of the planned merger. EXCL affirmed that all employees will become employees of the merged entity, and that existing employment terms will be fully guaranteed and unchanged during the transition. The clarification was issued amid a mass‑leave action by EXCL employees demanding transparency in the merger process with FREN. EXCL said the mass‑leave had no impact on the company's operational activities.

tickerNews.title: Bumi Resources Targets $5.5‑6 Billion Revenue in 2025
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources ($BUMI) announced a revenue target of US$5.5‑6 billion for 2025. The company aims to produce around 78‑80 million tonnes of coal, assuming higher prices than in 2024. BUMI obtained government approval to produce 80 million tonnes of coal in 2025, comprising 55 million tonnes from PT Kaltim Prima Coal at an average gross ash ratio (GAR) of 5,000 and 25 million tonnes from PT Arutmin Indonesia at an average GAR of 4,400. The company also noted that the timing of a quasi‑reorganization remains uncertain, but BUMI intends to distribute dividends after the reorganization is completed.

tickerNews.title: Sejahteraraya Plans $125 Million 7‑Year Bond Issuance
tickerNews.content: Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya ($SRAJ) plans to issue a $125 million, seven‑year bond to entities owned by Bain Capital Credit LP. The bond amount equals 101.61 percent of SRAJ's equity as of September 2024. Proceeds will support working capital and business development, including expansion of Mayapada Hospital Jakarta Selatan and construction of new hospitals such as Mayapada Apollo Batam International Hospital and Mayapada Hospital Surabaya 2. The bond will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 20 January 2025. This plan is part of Bain Capital Credit's $157 million investment in SRAJ, marking the first investment by the US firm in Indonesia (source: https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202412/43e53d07a1_f28b66fdd4.pdf; https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/bain-capital-invests-157-mln-indonesias-mayapada-healthcare-group-2024-12-12/; https://snips.stockbit.com/snips-terbaru/aadi-ara-pada-hari-listing-pups-mulai-6-desember#:~:text=%24SRAJ%3A%C2%A0Sejahteraraya,swasta%20asal%20AS.).

tickerNews.title: PT PP Reports New Contract Value of Approximately 26.2 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: PT PP ($PTPP) recorded new contract values of about 26.2 trillion rupiah in the first eleven months of 2024, a decline of 13.4 percent year‑on‑year, representing 81.7 percent of the 2024 target of 32 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Green Power Group Signs Power Purchase Agreement in Timor Leste
tickerNews.content: Green Power Group ($LABA) announced that it has signed a power purchase agreement (PPA) with a government institution in Oecusse, Timor Leste. The MoU also includes a plan for LABA to cooperate with a local company to develop a 5‑megawatt solar power plant and a battery energy storage system.

tickerNews.title: Jaya Agra Wattie Plans 1.3 Trillion Rupiah Interest‑Free Loan
tickerNews.content: Jaya Agra Wattie ($JAWA) intends to sign a loan of approximately 1.3 trillion rupiah from its controlling shareholder, PT Sarana Agro Investama. The loan, to be disbursed in stages according to demand, equals 227.5 percent of the company's book equity as of 30 June 2024. The interest‑free loan will be used to repay interest‑bearing bank debt and to fund operational activities. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 13 December 2024 (source: https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202412/ea1a44d492_d62bc1e06d.pdf).

tickerNews.title: MNC Kapital Indonesia Plans Up to 500 Billion Rupiah Bond Issuance
tickerNews.content: MNC Kapital Indonesia ($BCAP) plans to issue bonds up to 500 billion rupiah to refinance existing bonds and fund working capital. The issuance will consist of Series A (370‑day tenor), Series B (3‑year tenor) and Series C (5‑year tenor). The bonds have not yet disclosed interest rates. The public offering is scheduled for 2‑7 January 2025. The issuance has received a rating of idBBB+ from Pefindo.
